p: The increased incidence of GBS after swine flu vaccination raised several claims that the vaccine was the cause of several other infectious or immune-mediated diseases, including postvaccinal encephalopathy, myelopathy, and peripheral nerve lesions [ 37]. These claims led the US government to ask Leonard T. Kurland, an eminent US neuroepidemiologist from the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, USA, to provide reference data on the incidence of a number of infectious and immune-mediated inflammatory neurological diseases, including encephalitis and aseptic meningitis [ 38], acute transverse myelitis [ 39], brachial plexus neuropathy [ 40], and GBS [ 41], and calculate the excess number of individuals who could experience the same symptoms as a result of the adverse effects of the vaccine. This interesting experience provides the background for correct investigation of the measure of the risk in the presence of a possible association between an etiological agent (in our case, the COVID-19) and a neurological disease.
